column4: how do i create a file with 800GB quickly? dd if=/dev/zero takes so long!
get a quicker hard drive, fool
did you ever had to write  800GB file??
yes. I did it on a RAID0.
is there an other way then dd it from /dev/zero?
buying faster harddrives is not possible
listen, ok? Your hard drive is the bottleneck, not dd. There is nothing you can do to speed it up.
hard drives are bottlenecks in -most systems-, you hear? Writing to them is -slow- by comparison to RAM.
well, i can not change the bottleneck. i have to live with it
for win there seems to be tools for that: http://windowsitpro.com/article/articleid/40935/how-can-i-create-a-file-of-a-certain-size-in-windows-xp-and-later.html
there seems to be tools for that in Linux too. It's called 'dd'.
if your file is 100% redundant then you could use something like zfs to compress it, and possibly reduce the bottleneck significantly.
consider looking at zfs for your nas.
what with dd and the seek option??
haha, i did: dd if=/dev/zero of=/media/linkstation1/container bs=1024 seek=799999990 count=800000000 and voila: got a 800GB file very, very quickly!
